definition: section/paragraph/funds/CL:筆|笔[bi3],個|个[ge4]/classifier for versions or models (of a product)

sentences.english: The Chinese Red Cross contributed a generous sum to the relief of the physically disabled.
sentences.chinese: 中国红十字会慷慨捐赠一笔巨款以救济残疾人。

sentences.english: Such a bill would strain Japan's already fragile fiscal health.
sentences.chinese: 如此一笔巨款会打击到日本已经很脆弱的财政状况。

sentences.english: But this system depends on an ever-growing pot of money.
sentences.chinese: 但这个系统指靠每年都在增长的一笔巨款。

sentences.english: Three thousand pounds! he could spare so considerable a sum with little inconvenience.
sentences.chinese: 三千镑呀，我可以毫不费劲地省出这么一笔巨款。

sentences.english: They have subscribed large sums to the fund.
sentences.chinese: 他们向基金会捐了巨款。

sentences.english: The government anted up a large sum of money to build a testing center.
sentences.chinese: 政府拨出巨款建立一个试验中心。

sentences.english: The taxes came up to a huge sum.
sentences.chinese: 各种税加起来是一笔巨款。

sentences.english: Billionaires swarmed into Nice to splurge millions during the summer holidays.
sentences.chinese: 暑期休假时，亿万富翁们群趋尼斯挥霍了百万巨款。

sentences.english: The banks could borrow huge mounts against relatively little capital.
sentences.chinese: 这些银行能用相对小的资本借得巨款。

sentences.english: Olivia says that carrying a large amount of cash makes you vulnerable to pickpockets.
sentences.chinese: 奥利弗说身携巨款的你很难让你不吸引到小偷的注意。

sentences.english: Does a huge sum of money of brushstroke accident return finally fall where?
sentences.chinese: 一笔意外的巨款最终归落何处？

definition: to owe a debt/the sum owed
coin/money/CL:筆|笔[bi3]/unit of weight, one tenth of a tael 兩|两[liang3]
pen/pencil/writing brush/to write or compose/the strokes of Chinese characters/classifier for sums of money, deals/CL:支[zhi1],枝[zhi1]
